## Generate a unique ID (UUID). From [Stackoverflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/105034/create-guid-uuid-in-javascript).

```{js, eval = FALSE}
function generateUUID () { // Public Domain/MIT
    var d = new Date().getTime();
    if (typeof performance !== 'undefined' && typeof performance.now === 'function'){
        d += performance.now(); //use high-precision timer if available
    }
    return 'xxxxxxxx-xxxx-4xxx-yxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx'.replace(/[xy]/g, function (c) {
        var r = (d + Math.random() * 16) % 16 | 0;
        d = Math.floor(d / 16);
        return (c === 'x' ? r : (r & 0x3 | 0x8)).toString(16);
    });
}
```

## Generate the Statistical week from a date. For WDFW the standard statistical week starts on Monday and ends on Sunday. The first day of the year is always week 1. This function mimics output from a legacy WDFW executable to generate stat weeks. To use in a mobile form create a new text element below your `survey_start_datetime` element. Then in the *Dynamic Value* box enter: `survey_start_datetime.fishStatWeek()`.    

```{js, eval = FALSE}
Date.prototype.fishStatWeek = function () {
  var jan_one = new Date(this.getFullYear(), 0, 1);
  var week_day = jan_one.getDay();
  var adj_day = -1;
  if (week_day === 0) adj_day = 0;
  var n_days = ((this - jan_one) / 86400000) + 1;
  return Math.ceil((n_days + week_day - 1) / 7) + adj_day + 1;
};
```

## Pad a number with three leading zeros. For example, change `01` to `0001`, or `2` to `0002`. Author: Jake Shapely.  

```{js, eval = FALSE}
function pad(num) {
    var s = num + "";
    while (s.length < 3) s = "0" + s;
    return s;
};
```
